snippet: Using genetic testing, an ocean conservation group found that nearly 40 percent of the seafood from 81 grocery stores and restaurants was not what the establishment claimed it was.
abstract: Ocean conservation group Oceana releases report finding 40 percent of seafood from 81 grocery stores and restaurants in New York City deceptively mislabeled; group charges that many customers end up eating fish that is not what was on the menu or store label.
lead_paragraph: Using genetic testing, an ocean conservation group found that nearly 40 percent of the seafood from 81 grocery stores and restaurants was not what the establishment claimed it was.

headline.seo: Mislabeled Foods Find Their Way to Diners’ Tables
headline.main: Under Many Aliases, Mislabeled Foods Find Their Way to Dinner Tables
headline.print_headline: Under Many Aliases, Mislabeled Foods Find Their Way to Dinner Tables
